text: Toy & Wing were an Asian-American tap dance duo. The duo were known as Dorothy Toy (real name Shigeko Takahashi, May 28, 1917 – July 10, 2019) and Paul Wing (real name Paul Wing Jew, October 14, 1912 – April 27, 1997). They were known as the "Chinese Fred Astaire and Ginger Rogers". They were active in the 1930s and 1940s. They were the first Asian-Americans to enter the American tap dance scene. Dorothy Toy was born on May 28, 1917 in San Francisco. She died on July 10, 2019 in Oakland, California at the age of 102. Paul Wing was born in Menlo Park, California on October 14, 1912 and died on April 27, 1997 at the Veterans Home of California located in Yountville, California. He was 85 years old. ==References== Category:1917 births Category:2019 deaths Category:1912 births Category:1997 deaths Category:American centenarians Category:American dancers Category:Entertainers from California Category:People from San Francisco Category:People from Menlo Park, California
title: Toy & Wing
